scripts.say: I brought my sister here.Ta-da!
Good afternoon everyone from the Dragon Empery~ Um, I heard from Saratoga that you are celebrating a festival called the “Mid-Autumn Festival”.
Oh wow, is this Sara's big sister? So beautiful! Will Sara also grow up to be so pretty?!
Yes, do you wish to join us Ms. Lexington?

Of course~ how can a festival be missing an idol like myself! Will you allow me to join you in the celebrations, too?! Also, how come you address my sister as “Lady Sara”, but call me “Miss Lexington?” You can call me “Lady Lex!”
Welcome welcome~ although there is no say of inviting idols to this festival...
Lady Lex...?
GOOD! Although... even though it's a celebration, I'm still unclear in exactly how we should celebrate the Mid-Autumn Festival?
It's about a gathering of friends and family, everyone sits together wishing for fortune and happiness, as well as reminiscing about the past with loved ones.
Is this a bit like “Memorial Day” celebrated in my country?
No…most likely...not...
But to me, these two festivals both sound similar? It's all about commemorating our…
I'm still alive... not a martyr yet...
So sorry, I lost track of my words~ anyways, is the preparation for the festival almost finished? Is there anything else that my sister and I can help with?
No need, the guests should just relax --- Hey! Where are those Ping Hai and Ning Hai sisters?!
We're making lanterns! Ping Hai told me that it's a tradition during the Mid-Autumn Festival?
When talking about the Mid-Autumn Festival, other than mooncakes and osmanthus wine, the lantern is definitely a must-have traditional item!
Oh no….where did you put the mooncakes...
In short, with the help of Lady Sara, the lanterns were finished in no time! Those carriers sure are amazing!
Wow….so many lanterns, we'll definitely be able to attract good fortune and protection---

At night, let my sister and I “fly up” to those lanterns. That way, not only will they shine but they'll also emanate a beautiful sound, like a “dance in the sky”! My friends are also eager to try on these festive clothes!
A bunch of lanterns roaring and dancing up in the sky...
This isn't what we want to have for the festival...
